subject: IEEE Event 21 August - Radio Frequency ID via Drones
body:
Hello, There is still time to register for the August 21th IEEE Central Coast Event, *UAV-RFID for Outdoor Applications, *presented by Professor Tali Freed Ph.D. at *Flightline Restaurant. *Please see below for Details. Guests are welcome. Registrations for you and your guests must be made before Wednesday August 21. I will report the exact number of registrants to Flightline Restaurant on Tuesday evening so that they can prepare the appropriate amount of food for the buffet on Wednesday evening. Best regards, Ruth Franklin, IEEE Central Coast Chair *REGISTER for EVENT @* - https://events.vtools.ieee.org/m/201787 *IEEE Central Coast Event 21 August 2019 @ 6PM* *Professor Tali Freed **Ph. D., P.E. - Cal Poly**: **UAV-RFID for Outdoor Applications**FREE EVENT - But must Register for food count* *Location Flightline Restaurant * 521 Firestone Rd, Goleta, CA, 93117 [image: image.png] 6:00 PM Buffet Style Dinner menu includes BBQ Chicken, Tri-tip, Salmon, Rice, Vegetables. Salad, Bread 6:25 PM Central Coast Status 6:30 PM Professor Freed Presentation *REGISTER for EVENT @ * - https://events.vtools.ieee.org/m/201787 *UAV-RFID for Outdoor Applications * *Optimizing a UAV-RFID Cattle Search Tour* *Efficiently managing oilfield equipment inventory* This presentation will introduce *PolyGAIT* the Cal Poly Center for Global Automatic Identification Technologies, its past R&D achievements and current fronts. Recent applied research on combined systems of unmanned aerial vehicles (*UAV*) and radio frequency identification (*RFID*) will be described. Commercial applicability and extensions of this research will be discussed. [image: image.png] *Professor Tali Freed Ph.D., P.E.* Dr. Tali Freed received her Ph.D. from the U.C. Berkeley Department of Industrial Engineering and Operations Research. Her B.Sc. and M.Sc. are in Industrial Engineering and Management, from the Technion Israel Institute of Technology. Prior to starting her studies at the Technion Dr. Freed completed her mandatory military service in the Israeli Air Force, as the first woman technician in the force. Dr. Freed is a faculty member of the Industrial and Manufacturing Engineering Department of Cal Poly San Luis Obispo. She currently serves as the Graduate Programs and Senior Projects Coordinator for the department. Dr. Freeds primary areas of teaching, research, development, and consulting are RFID (radio frequency identification), process improvement, planning and scheduling, and design of information systems. She is certified as a Professional Engineer in the state of California, and the Director of PolyGAIT, The Multidisciplinary Cal Poly Center for Global Automatic Identification Technologies. http://www.polygait.calpoly.edu/ Dr. Freed has been a faculty member at Cal Poly since 2001. She has also been adjunct faculty at the Naval Postgraduate School in Monterey and several other universities in the US and Israel. Dr. Freed invented and patented an efficient RFID-enabled process for food traceability. She specializes in custom-design of RFID systems for cost reduction and increased productivity. In the last two decades Dr. Freed has been consulting with many commercial, governmental, and non-profit organizations. Executives and engineers from various organizations frequently visit PolyGAIT to learn about RFID and its uses for process improvement. She has advised hundreds of these projects and published numerous academic and industrial articles and reports. She is frequently invited to speak at professional conferences and conventions.

Hello,

There is still time to register for the August 21th IEEE Central Coast Event, UAV-RFID for Outdoor Applications, presented by Professor Tali Freed Ph.D. at Flightline Restaurant. Please see below for Details. Guests are welcome. 

Registrations for you and your guests must be made before Wednesday August 21. I will report the exact number of registrants to Flightline Restaurant on Tuesday evening so that they can prepare the appropriate amount of food for the buffet on Wednesday evening.

Best regards, 

Ruth Franklin, IEEE Central Coast Chair

REGISTER for EVENT @ - https://events.vtools.ieee.org/m/201787  


IEEE Central Coast Event 21 August 2019 @ 6PM

Professor Tali Freed Ph. D., P.E. - Cal Poly: UAV-RFID for Outdoor Applications
FREE EVENT - But must Register for food count

Location  Flightline Restaurant                                 

521 Firestone Rd, Goleta, CA, 93117


6:00 PM Buffet Style Dinner menu includes               

              BBQ Chicken, Tri-tip, Salmon,

              Rice, Vegetables. Salad, Bread

6:25 PM Central Coast Status

6:30 PM Professor Freed Presentation

REGISTER for EVENT @  - https://events.vtools.ieee.org/m/201787

UAV-RFID for Outdoor Applications

        Optimizing a UAV-RFID Cattle Search Tour

        Efficiently managing oilfield equipment inventory

This presentation will introduce PolyGAIT  the Cal Poly Center for Global Automatic Identification Technologies, its past R&D achievements and current fronts. Recent applied research on combined systems of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) and radio frequency identification (RFID) will be described. Commercial applicability and extensions of this research will be discussed.

   

 

Professor Tali Freed  Ph.D., P.E.

Dr. Tali Freed received her Ph.D. from the U.C. Berkeley Department of Industrial Engineering and Operations Research. Her B.Sc. and M.Sc. are in Industrial Engineering and Management, from the Technion Israel Institute of Technology.  Prior to starting her studies at the Technion Dr. Freed completed her mandatory military service in the Israeli Air Force, as the first woman technician in the force. Dr. Freed is a faculty member of the Industrial and Manufacturing Engineering Department of Cal Poly San Luis Obispo. She currently serves as the Graduate Programs and Senior Projects Coordinator for the department. Dr. Freeds primary areas of teaching, research, development, and consulting are RFID (radio frequency identification), process improvement, planning and scheduling, and design of information systems. She is certified as a Professional Engineer in the state of California, and the Director of PolyGAIT, The Multidisciplinary Cal Poly Center for Global Automatic Identification Technologies.  http://www.polygait.calpoly.edu/

Dr. Freed has been a faculty member at Cal Poly since 2001. She has also been adjunct faculty at the Naval Postgraduate School in Monterey and several other universities in the US and Israel. Dr. Freed invented and patented an efficient RFID-enabled process for food traceability. She specializes in custom-design of RFID systems for cost reduction and increased productivity. In the last two decades Dr. Freed has been consulting with many commercial, governmental, and non-profit organizations. Executives and engineers from various organizations frequently visit PolyGAIT to learn about RFID and its uses for process improvement. She has advised hundreds of these projects and published numerous academic and industrial articles and reports. She is frequently invited to speak at professional conferences and conventions.
